result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon D. Morgan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 12 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $200 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jon D. Morgan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from DE requesting early termination of probation - the Court will require the petition for early termination to be filed by the agent

Case called @ 3:03 p.m. Defendant Jon D. Morgan in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Johnson. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 18 mos probation as to each count concurrent - Conditions: AODA and follow through,  defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs to include the DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal rights given.  Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 12 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed. Bond previously posted to be applied.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-22-2015 02:45 pm
Exhibit #1-DVD stored in vault on bottom exhibit shelf
Status conference at 05-26-2015 09:45 am

2:09 pm case called. Defendant Jon D. Morgan in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter scheduled for a suppression motion. Statement by DA Blader and video submitted to the court. Statement by Attorney Johnson regarding motion and video submitted to the court. Further statement of DA Blader. Further statement by Attorney Johnson. Court marks video as exhibit #1 and receives into record. Court makes statement regarding video. Court denies the motion to suppress. Statement by Attorney Johnson regarding cash confiscated during the warrant. Statement by DA Blader regarding cash confiscated during the search warrant execution. Court orders cash confiscated during the search warrant to be returned to the defendant within 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 09:45 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Thomas W. Johnson in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Johnson requests motion hearing date.  Court schedules 1 hr Suppression Motion Hearing as requested.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on March 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:51 p.m. Defendant Jon D. Morgan in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  NGP entered. Court orders $200 Cash Bond - already posted. The defendant waives any conflict of interest with Atty Johnson representing both him and the co-defendant in this matter. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
